0145fd20-8b21-4d68-9bb4-ef99646da17e.content:
## 🧠 **MyTGuy Brand Index**

| Section | Details |
| --- | --- |
| **Brand Name** | MyTGuy |
| **Tagline** | "Your IT Guy, On Call." |
| **Brand Purpose** | To make IT support approachable, fast, and dependable for small businesses. |
| **Vision Statement** | To be the friendly face of IT support—bringing clarity and calm to technical chaos. |
| **Core Values** | Simplicity, Trust, Speed, Friendliness, Proactivity |
| **Positioning** | The go-to outsourced IT department for small businesses that need expert support without the cost or complexity of an internal team. |
| **Target Audience** | Small business owners and office managers (5–50 employees), particularly non-tech-savvy decision-makers. |
| **Brand Personality** | Friendly, Tech-savvy, Approachable, Clever, Reliable |
| **Brand Voice** | Conversational, helpful, slightly witty but never over-the-top; simplifies tech without sounding condescending. |
| **Visual Style** | - **Logo**: Curly braces + eyes = human-tech hybrid 🧑‍💻  - **Colors**: Green (#00FF96), White, Dark Gray  - **Fonts**: Montserrat or Inter |
| **Messaging Pillars** | 1. **We're Your Tech Guy** – We speak your language, not jargon.  2. **Always On Call** – Fast, responsive, and reliable.  3. **Peace of Mind** – We handle IT so you can run your business. |
| **Differentiator** | Unlike faceless MSPs, MyTGuy offers a personal, friendly face to IT — it's like having a trusted tech-savvy friend on standby. |
| **Competitor** | ThrottleNet — more corporate tone, which you can contrast with MyTGuy’s personal, human-first approach. |

---

### 🔧 Bonus Add-On Ideas

| Phase | Element | Strategy |
| --- | --- | --- |
| **1. Brand Core** | **Brand Purpose** | To empower small businesses with reliable, on-demand IT support. |
|  | **Brand Vision** | To become the most trusted outsourced IT partner for small businesses across the region. |
|  | **Core Values** | Reliability, Responsiveness, Simplicity, Empowerment, Trust |
| **2. Brand Positioning** | **Target Audience** | Small businesses (5–50 employees) lacking in-house IT but needing expert tech support |
|  | **Market Analysis** | ThrottleNet is a key competitor, but many MSPs overlook **relationship-building** and **education**—MyTGuy can win by being more approachable and hands-on. |
|  | **Awareness Goals** | Build brand awareness through referrals, local partnerships, and educational content (e.g. “Tech Tips for Small Teams”) |
| **3. Brand Persona** | **Brand Personality** | Friendly, Approachable, Tech-savvy, Clear, Dependable |
|  | **Brand Voice** | Conversational yet professional — simplify tech talk and be a “guy you trust” |
|  | **Brand Tagline** | “Your IT Guy, When You Need One.” or “Your Tech Guy, On Call.” |

---

- A **visual identity or logo** for MyTGuy?
- A **website or landing page** layout?
- Or your **brand messaging** in more detail?

### You said:

[](https://files09.oaiusercontent.com/file-HTsK5SzFJfvpDza7ZDL7eD?se=2025-04-13T05%3A49%3A31Z&sp=r&sv=2024-08-04&sr=b&rscc=max-age%3D299%2C%20immutable%2C%20private&rscd=attachment%3B%20filename%3DMYTGUYLOGO-topaz-denoise-sharpen.png&sig=fQ3%2BoNZzeH7xmkn5QbFFXQgqiO60M8qcChzN6UdMkY8%3D)

this is our logo wed like everything to fit this theme

### ChatGPT said:

Awesome! Your logo is clever and visually distinctive — the **curly braces and quotation marks form a face** (or even glasses), giving it a playful, techy personality while reinforcing the “guy” aspect in *My T Guy*. The green and white color palette on dark background gives a modern, tech-forward vibe. Let's align your **brand strategy and visual direction** to match that identity.

---

### 🔧 Updated Brand Strategy (Aligned with Logo Theme)

| Phase | Element | Strategy |
| --- | --- | --- |
| **1. Brand Core** | **Brand Purpose** | To make IT support approachable, fast, and dependable for small businesses. |
|  | **Brand Vision** | To be the friendly face of IT support—bringing clarity and calm to technical chaos. |
|  | **Core Values** | Simplicity, Trust, Speed, Friendliness, Proactivity |
| **2. Brand Positioning** | **Target Audience** | Small businesses (especially 5–50 employees) in need of expert IT help without the overhead of an internal department. |
|  | **Market Analysis** | Competitors often look cold or corporate — MyTGuy's approachable, almost humanized branding (the face in the logo!) gives it an edge. |
|  | **Awareness Goals** | Focus on community-driven outreach, testimonials, explainer videos, and content with a “human tech” angle (e.g. “Ask MyTGuy”) |
| **3. Brand Persona** | **Brand Personality** | Geeky but friendly, clever but clear, always helpful. Think: the IT guy who’s actually fun to talk to. |
|  | **Brand Voice** | Relatable, confident, slightly witty — break down complex ideas without dumbing it down |
|  | **Tagline Options** | 1. “Your IT Guy, On Call.”2. “The Friendly Face of IT.”3. “Tech Support That Gets You.” |

---

### 🎨 Visual & Style Guide Recommendations

| Element | Suggestion |
| --- | --- |
| **Color Palette** | Stick with **green (#00FF96 or similar)** for highlights, **white** for text, and **charcoal/dark gray** background. |
| **Typography** | Use modern sans-serif fonts like **Montserrat**, **Inter**, or **Manrope** — clean and tech-forward. |
| **Imagery** | Use illustrations or avatars in the same quirky, clean style as your logo. Avoid stocky corporate photos. |
| **Tone** | Use humor sparingly (think clever vs. corny), and always aim for clarity first. |

---

Would you like me to help design:

- A **landing page layout** based on this style?
- A **brand messaging doc** for your website or sales deck?
- Or maybe ideas for your **social content or lead magnets**?
